value: This message is intentionally designed to exceed the 500-character limit specified in the test instructions. Its length ensures that the form's validation mechanisms for maximum input length are properly triggered and evaluated. By providing an excessively long string, we can verify how the system handles such an input, particularly whether the expected error messages appear and other related UI behaviors are correctly observed. This includes checking for error message visibility, styling, and positioning relative to the input field, which are crucial aspects of user feedback for form submissions. This lengthy input serves a specific purpose in testing the boundary conditions of the text area.
